result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)Defendant must complete anger management counseling and provide documentation of completion to the DA.  
4)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
5)Defendant must report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
6) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey Lawrence Duden

records.addlTxt: 01:51 PM Defendant Jeffrey Lawrence Duden in court. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appears by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  State asks the court to consider defendant entering into a DAGPA.  If you adhere to the contract for a period of one year, that matter would be dismissed.  If you fail to adhere to the contract, the agreement could be revoked and you would be subject to the max. penalties.  Mr. Dudgen informs him and his wife are going to marriage counseling instead of anger management.  Marriage counseling would be a substitute for the anger management class?  This is the first the DA has heard of the substitution.  The VWC has been in contact with the alleged victim and if she finds it's a fit substitute, we can talk about it.  The court will take your plea today subject to the terms of the contract.  Contact the DA and if he wishes to change the anger management requirement to marriage counseling he can, then you sign and a contract and file it.  The DA will then contact me and we will bring you back, rescind the contract and continue the case from that case forward.  The DA is to notify me of any changes in the contract.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties.  Plea colloquy.  Defendant willing to proceed without counsel.  Court finds Mr. Dudgen knowingly, voluntarily waives right to counsel and other rights.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court defers acceptance of GP for 1 year, terms to be filed by Mr. Seifert within 7 days.  Contact Mr. Seifert tomorrow.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:59 PM Defendant Jeffrey Lawrence Duden in court without counsel.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by zoom technology by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Duden informs he will be representing himself.  Mr. Seifert has spoke with Mr. Duden and victim and offered a DAGPA which has been sent to Mr. Duden.  State asks matter be rescheduled to allow Mr. Duden to stop by his office to review the agreement and sign it if agrees to it.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:39 PM Defendant Jeffrey Lawrence Duden in court. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by zoom technology by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties and rights.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
